lines.text: [Sam and Baldy's "duel" ends when both men come face-to-face without drawing]
Well, what are you waiting for?
For you to start... itching.
Well, it's plain to see you're no gentleman!
[admiring Phoebe Ann's figure barely concealed by a wet blanket]
Well, it's plain to see you're not one, either.
Baldy's grave is down by the corral. The jury dug it before the trial started.
[repeated line]
A-roar haarrh!
This is night. Are you going to sleep?
Well, it ain't healthy to travel through Comanche territory in the daytime, so we'll travel at night.
Oh, when we ride, the savage sleeps. Yes?
Yep. Them Comanches believe the moon is an evil spirit.
Why you dumb, fool tenderfoot! Are you trying to take on that whole tribe single-handed?
When one is alone, one must become an army.
Have you no wish to live?
I wish to live, but what is life without honor?
What is honor without life?
I don't want to be a widow before I am a bride.
A man looks at many things, but sometimes he does not see what is under his eyes.
That is true, Lonetta. I myself have known such men.
A campfire gives flame, smoke. This you see.
Of course.
A fire inside gives no flmae, no smoke, but it burns as hot.
A fire inside?
In me there is such a fire. You do not see it, but it burns for you.
Ten paces.
Ten paces?
Why, that is customary. Do you wish to give the command to begin or shall I?
I don't know what you got in mind, Baldy, but I'm here for a shootout.
Precisely. You take ten steps that way; I take ten steps this way. Then we turn...
Turn? Step? I ain't here for no square dance! Now which end of town do you want to come from?
You stand so; I stand so. And then...
Back to back? Now what kind of shootout is that?
Please Sam Hollis. I have dueled many times in Spain and I'm...
But this isn't Spain - it's Texas!
Even a simple duel you cannot perform in a civilized manner!
We have had civilized killings around here for years. I come from one end of town like this and you come from the other end... and you get the itch, you draw.
[first lines]
Take it easy, Yancy. You got a wedding to go to.
Where in Texas? How will you find me?
I'll find you. Texas isn't even a state - how big can it be?
[the turkey shoot boss expresses doubts about Baldy's shooting ability]
Miss? I am a Baldazar!
Well, I'm a Baptist myself, but that never improved my aim none.
Is it possible there is more than one Texas?
Friend, if there was more than one, there wouldn't be room for nothin' else!
White man speak with forked tongue.
We do it.
How?
Fire and water. With fire, we drive longhorns from herd... three days, three nights we keep them from water. On fourth day, we let them drink.
On the fourth day, they'll be dead.
No! Will be tame. This is secret Comanche know.
I hope it is secret the longhorns also know.
[during an Indian attack, the settlers run out of ammunition]
Gun empty.
Yell, "Bang-bang."
For Comanche need bullets, not jokes.
Finish digging that grave, Sergeant.
Sergeant? But Rodney...
What was that, Corporal?
[last lines]
[an oil gusher erupts from the grave Lt. Sibley was digging]
Every time dig hole, black poison shoot up! Now have to move town.

[disgusted]
Texas. Pah!
Eh, if it was up to me, I'd give it back to the Indians.
Who wants it?
[Baldy attempts to rescue an Indian girl from a rattlesnake wielding medicine man]
He either likes girls or he's crazy about snakes.
A-roar haarrh!
Why couldn't you have been born a Comanche?
Mother run too fast.
Comanche run for hills.
[Looks at Sam Hollis]
Why you look so funny?

[In Kornk's language]
Too mah kunoh tee hee sooti kaygoh-honi. And one laugh outta you and I'll boot you so hard your whole tribe'll fall down.
